channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024060072
item.description:
Report E-2024060072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1760 Reverse-A-Crete release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-ounces of product released to the drum lid only. The drum was wiped down and placed into an 85-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbent pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060108
item.description:
Report E-2024060108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the drum that arrived leaking, approximately 2.5-gallons of BYK-W 996 (hazardous - UN1993) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri will be placed into a 65 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024060076
item.description:
Report E-2024060076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 53ft-by-8ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that forty (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. Hepaco personnel used water to gather the released material and then deployed a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized along with impacted debris into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damage drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060008
item.description:
Report E-2024060008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: BERLIN HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver notice liquid escaping from trailer on 4/29/2024 and he pulled over on the shoulder and proceeded to put down absorbents to create a dam preventing it from spreading further. He then called our emergency response number and 911 approximately 1825 CT. Local fire showed up and a container was put under the valve that was leaking. Federal, State, and Local EPS agency's were notified ant approximately 1845 CT We dispatched a team to the scene they arrived at approximately 2130 CT. They spoke with the local EPA that was on scene and then began clean up. The clean up was completed at approximately 1700 CT 4/30/2024.

item.title: Report I-2024040081
item.description:
Report I-2024040081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T00:37:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: PAINESVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS CHEMICAL SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was scheduled to get loaded at PVS Nolwood Painesville, OH with a shipment of Sodium Hydroxide 50%. During the loading process approximately 100 gallons overfilled the tanker-trailer. The driver noticed product was released from the compartment and notified the plant, which shut down the flow.

item.title: Report X-2024051491
item.description:
Report X-2024051491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: BELLEVUE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NS personnel found tank car GATX2715 leaking product from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found to be coming from the liquid line blind flange. All the bolts on the blind flange were found to be loose. The flange was properly tightened to stop the leak. The car was held to allow a certified shop inspect the flange bolts for damage.
